_inspectorSnowReport.Report:
January 30th, 11:02 AM
*Heaven's Gate, NorthRidge and Summit are on wind hold* *GMX is closed due to maintenance*
Good morning skiers and riders. Another cold front is upon us, keeping things frosty and the snow riding beautifully. Todays forecast brings partly sunny skies with some strong morning winds that could affect lift operations, so keep an eye out for updates. Temps stay icy, with negative single digits up top and low single digits at the base. Snowmaking wrapped up on Jester last night, and itll be serving up fresh corduroy this morning. The crew has shifted over to Sunrise for a little refill action. Well be skiing and riding over 450 skiable acres, with 48 of 110 trails groomed, including favorites like Ripcord, Waterfall, and Cruiser. Brambles will be reserved for racing until 10:30 PM, and Inverness will remain closed tomorrow. Cold getting to you again? Hang in there, weve got another snowstorm on the way this weekend since you seemed to love the last one so much.

GMX remains down for scheduled maintenance, so Inverness will open at 8:00 AM, with Northridge Express spinning shortly after. All other scheduled lifts open at 9:00 AM. Slide Brook will be closed today due to cold temperatures. Look forward to beautiful firm groomers along with firm packed powder conditions across the mountain. Sugarbush still has plenty of freestyle fun on tap. At Mt. Ellen, youll find over 80 features on Riemergasse and another 27 on Sugar Run, all serviced by the iconic Sunny Quad. At Lincoln Peak, Slowpoke now has 12 refreshed features with a couple more coming, and 7 playful features remain over in Sugarbear Forest.

Play Blizzard Bingo all month long as part of NSAA Safety Month! Ski, ride, and learn across Sugarbush throughout January. Swing by the Creation Station, across from Guest Services at both Lincoln Peak and Mt. Ellen, to design your own safetythemed poster. Todays tip: Warm Up First. Fun for all ages, and a great way to celebrate Safety Month while checking out our winter events.

All uphill travel routes are open at both Lincoln Peak and Mt. Ellen. Please review our Uphill Travel Policy for full details.
